--- title: "4.3 — Pricing Strategies — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Monday, May 1, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we look at how firms price their products when they have market power (that is to say, how most firms in reality price their products). ## Readings - Ch. 10 in Goolsbee, Levitt, and Syverson, 2019 ### Recommended Reading - [ *NPR Planet Money* 416: “Why The Price of Coke Didn't Change For 70 years”](https://www.npr.org/2019/05/01/719213730/episode-416-why-the-price-of-coke-didnt-change-for-70-years) - [ *NPR Planet Money* 653: “The anti-store”](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2015/09/25/443519599/episode-653-the-anti-store) - [ *NPR Planet Money* 633: “The Birth and Death of the Price Tag”](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2015/06/17/415287577/episode-633-the-birth-and-death-of-the-price-tag) - [ Why Trains are so Expensive](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwjwePe-HmA) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF
